Title: BI Data Analyst (Full Remote)
Description:
Company Profile

With studios around the world, Keywords Studios is a leading technical services provider for global video games and beyond. With locations in Asia, the Americas and Europe, Keywords Studios has a breadth and depth in multiple industry-leading service lines including Art, Engineering, Audio, Functionality QA, Localization, Localization QA and Player Support. Working across all major platforms, in over 50 different languages, Keywords Studios delivers support for its clients across the globe.

Role Overview

The Business Intelligence Data Analyst will become a subject matter expert for BI (data & analytics) on all intelligence-related tasks. The Analyst will work independently and in a team environment performing requirements gathering, data analysis, process mapping, test case definition, development, and collaboration across multiple business units and projects.

Requirements

Located in Spain, no sponsorship required
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent time management and organizational skills.
Detail oriented but able to understand the big picture.
Ability to analyze and document complex business processes.
Experience communicating with business users.
3+ years’ experience with Power BI
Proficiency with DAX and M languages
Proficiency with Python
2-3 years’ experience with Spark/Databricks.
Strong SQL Server SQL skills and experience tuning queries, Working knowledge of data warehouse.


Additional Preferred Qualifications

Statistical computing experience
Exposure to the Azure Data Platform (Data Factory, etc.)
Exposure with DevOps implementation practices
Scrum methodology delivery experience


Duties And Responsibilities

Develop and implement interactive analytic reports and dashboards.
Translate business requirements into ETL and report specifications.
Develop and implement ETL processes, reports and queries in support of business analytics.
Perform data analysis to troubleshoot data issues with the BI solutions and data integration processes
Ensure compliance with security policies and practices in accordance with internal and external audit governing bodies.
Support data governance processes.
Provide technical and business knowledge support to the team.
Support data governance processes.


Benefits

Our employees are our most valuable resource; therefore we provide them with a competitive compensation package commensurate with skills and experience, excellent benefits, high level of job satisfaction and a casual and fun work environment.
Show more Show less
HTML:
Company Profile

With studios around the world, Keywords Studios is a leading technical services provider for global video games and beyond. With locations in Asia, the Americas and Europe, Keywords Studios has a breadth and depth in multiple industry-leading service lines including Art, Engineering, Audio, Functionality QA, Localization, Localization QA and Player Support. Working across all major platforms, in over 50 different languages, Keywords Studios delivers support for its clients across the globe.

Role Overview

The Business Intelligence Data Analyst will become a subject matter expert for BI (data & analytics) on all intelligence-related tasks. The Analyst will work independently and in a team environment performing requirements gathering, data analysis, process mapping, test case definition, development, and collaboration across multiple business units and projects.

Requirements
  • Located in Spain, no sponsorship required
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Detail oriented but able to understand the big picture.
  • Ability to analyze and document complex business processes.
  • Experience communicating with business users.
  • 3+ years’ experience with Power BI
  • Proficiency with DAX and M languages
  • Proficiency with Python
  • 2-3 years’ experience with Spark/Databricks.
  • Strong SQL Server SQL skills and experience tuning queries, Working knowledge of data warehouse.

Additional Preferred Qualifications
  • Statistical computing experience
  • Exposure to the Azure Data Platform (Data Factory, etc.)
  • Exposure with DevOps implementation practices
  • Scrum methodology delivery experience

Duties And Responsibilities
  • Develop and implement interactive analytic reports and dashboards.
  • Translate business requirements into ETL and report specifications.
  • Develop and implement ETL processes, reports and queries in support of business analytics.
  • Perform data analysis to troubleshoot data issues with the BI solutions and data integration processes
  • Ensure compliance with security policies and practices in accordance with internal and external audit governing bodies.
  • Support data governance processes.
  • Provide technical and business knowledge support to the team.
  • Support data governance processes.

Benefits

Our employees are our most valuable resource; therefore we provide them with a competitive compensation package commensurate with skills and experience, excellent benefits, high level of job satisfaction and a casual and fun work environment.

Title: Data Analyst - BI
Description:
Para una empresa leader global en el sector agroalimentario, me encuentro en la selección de un perfil Analista de Business Intelligence. Basado en Madrid, tu misión será desarrollar, estructurar y ayudar a la organización a utilizar los datos para una mejor toma de decisiones a nivel de negocio.







Responsabilidades:



Desarrollo y mantenimiento de informes y dashboards
Análisis de datos
Resolución de problemas
Gestión de proyectos
Extracción, transformación y carga de datos (ETL)
Reportarás al head of business application









Requisitos:



- Min 2-3 años de experiencia como Data Analyst y/o Analista BI



- Grado en ingeniería matemática o estadística, master en Big Data muy valorado



- Stack tecnológico: Microsoft, SQL server, Power BI, Python



- Nivel de inglés alto fundamental



- Actitud proactiva y excelente capacidad analítica







Se ofrece:



- Contrato permanente con cliente final



- Equipo de trabajo proactivo y de gran expertise técnico



- Proyecto retador, estable y de gran proyección



- Full time, 8h al día



- Paquete salarial muy competitivo + beneficios sociales.



- Ubicación en Madrid centro

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about data analysis and willing to have a real impact on improving data culture in a global organization? Then join us as a Senior Data Analyst! Data is at the heart of everything we do, and we’re looking for a candidate who can take ownership of technical data assets, and support all other departments in making full use of them.




You will be remotely working with a seasoned and highly motivated, multi-cultural team of Data Engineers, DataOps, Data Scientists and Data Analysts spread across Europe. You will have the challenge of supporting business needs in a fast-changing environment and helping AirHelp reach the next level of data maturity.




You will work with the team on developing relevant data models and generating valuable insights. You will also be in charge of conducting advanced analysis and developing appealing visualizations, dashboards and storytellings for business stakeholders.




What you’ll do:




Work with business stakeholders to collect, understand and document business requirements.
Design and develop robust data models using Snowflake, dbt, etc.
Develop advanced analysis to obtain relevant insights and build appealing storytelling using HEX, Jupyter Notebooks, etc.
Design, develop, and maintain data-reporting dashboards using commercial BI tools.
Mentor and share your technical expertise with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts and other AirHelp technology colleagues.




Ideally, you’ll bring with you:




3+ years in a data analyst role working with large datasets, both using Python (Jupyter Notebooks, NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, etc) and commercial BI tools.
Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field like Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or any other with a strong quantitative component.
Proficient expertise in SQL, including the ability to clean, extract and manipulate data.
Experience with commercial BI tools (Periscope, Looker, Tableau or others).
Structured, critical, systematic and scientific thinking.
Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.




Nice to have:




Solid understanding of corporate financial processes (Budget, Forecast, Treasury)
Experience working in agile environments, preferably with Jira.
Hands-on experience with data transformation and data modeling using dbt framework.
Solid understanding of data warehousing principles, concepts and best practices.
Hands-on experience using Snowflake or similar Cloud Data Warehousing solutions (Redshift, BigQuery, etc).




Make a real impact on travel




At AirHelp, you will make a difference working with the world's largest organization specializing in air passenger rights. We support travelers around the world and help them get the compensation they deserve when their flight doesn't go according to the plan. We're a global, diverse team that helps make air travel better for all. In 10 years, we’ve helped 1.5 million people receive the compensation they were entitled to when their flight was delayed, canceled or diverted. We’re really proud of our 102k 5-star Trustpilot ratings.




Perks and benefits:




Internal training programs and knowledge-sharing events
Personalized progression plan
Language classes
Lunch subsidy
Flexible benefits: gym membership, personal education, childcare, public transportation, or leisure travel subsidy
MacBook Air
Hybrid workspace (partially remote, partially from one of our offices in Barcelona, Gdańsk or Krakόw)
Work from anywhere for 2 weeks a year
Team days
Events and parties




Next steps:




Video call with the Recruiter
Technical video call with Head of Data
Online meeting with the Data Team representatives
Short online meeting with a Finance Team representatives




AirHelp is, and always will be, an equal opportunity employer. We are proud of our diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all.

All of our offices are wheelchair accessible. We welcome applicants who have special needs and are happy to adjust our interview process to accommodate them.

We invite refugees and displaced people to join our team, please submit your application in English and we look forward to hearing from you.

Learn More About Us At

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analytics
Description:
En HAYS estamos colaborando con una empresa del Soluciones orientadas al ahorro energético y a la mejora del medioambiente mediante la gestión eficiente de las instalaciones, asesoramiento y control de los consumos de energía para edificios de toda índole.




Actualmente buscamos un perfil de Data Analytics para unirse a su equipo.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




Mas de 2 años de experiencia en este campo
Desarrollo y mantenimiento de ETL.
Conocimientos en Pentaho PDI
SQL Avanzado.




¿Cuáles son los requisitos?




Diseño y mantenimiento de procesos de validación y depuración de datos.
Automatización de procesos de gestión.
Generación de Dashboard , informes de negocio para la gerencia de la compañía con los Kpi’s solicitados.
Desarrollo y mantenimiento de los procesos ETL.

Persona proactiva, autónoma, y con ganas de aprender y asumir nuevos retos.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Modalidad Hibrida.
Horario: 08.30 – 14 + 15 – 18.
Ubicación: Madrid.
Salario competitivo.
Proyecto estable e innovador.

Estamos esperando perfiles como el tuyo, apasionados con la tecnología y que quiera enfrentarse a un nuevo reto. ¡Si es tu caso, responde a este email enviando tu CV para que podamos contarte más!

Title: Local Data Analyst
Description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 35,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

Objetivos

Este puesto es un rol clave en el mantenimiento de los sistemas que soportan las operaciones de la fábrica.

El Analista de Datos Locales (LDA) crea, cambia y mantiene los datos maestros locales (GMPs y de negocio) de la planta utilizando los procesos establecidos. Como parte de ese mantenimiento de los datos están las tareas de recopilación, introducción y limpieza de los datos en los sistemas SAP (R3/APO) y PMX entre otros, según los Procedimientos operativos estándar (SOP) aprobados.

Es el responsable de mantener en los sistemas el Material Master, Estructuras (BOM´s), Recetas, Recursos (Centros de Trabajo), Matrices de Transición y los Procedimientos de Producción de empaquetado, asegurando que los datos locales sean precisos y correctos mediante procesos de verificación y auditorias periódicas.

Responsabilidades

Ejecutar la actualización de todos los datos maestros en los sistemas MES y WES de la planta de producción. Todo ello en coordinación con los Global y Local Data Analyst de otras afiliadas y los responsables de datos maestros de las diferentes áreas de la Fábrica.
Gestionar las peticiones de cambios de datos a través de las herramientas aprobadas.
Participar activamente en los lanzamientos de nuevos productos y discontinuaciones desarrollando las tareas correspondientes al Local data Analyst en los tiempos marcados.
Cumplir la ejecución de las Políticas Globales y Procedimientos locales.
Incorporar, cuando se requiera, en procedimientos locales las nuevas operativas.
Verificar periódicamente los datos en los sistemas y garantizar su exactitud y consistencia.
Proporcionar a las áreas que lo requieran todo el soporte necesario en temas de datos para la optimización de sus procesos y para la resolución de incidencias del día a día.
Participar en revisiones y actualizaciones anuales de costes y estándares en preparación para el ejercicio del Plan de Negocios.
Ejecutar y analizar mensualmente el inventario Baja Rotación.
Participar en diferentes tipos de proyectos en el ámbito local y/o global.
Mantener un ambiente de trabajo seguro, trabajar de manera segura y responsable y apoyar todos los Objetivos Corporativos de Salud, Seguridad y Medio Ambiente.


Habilidades Personales

Capacidad de comunicación y de trabajo en equipo.
Capacidad de organización, priorización y atención al detalle.
Capacidad para analizar, anticipar y resolver problemas complejos (técnicos, operativos o relacionados con el negocio).


Requerimientos De Formación

Técnico Superior en Administración y Finanzas.
No se requiere experiencia.
Conocimientos en Informática a nivel de usuario.
Conocimientos Excel y otras herramientas Office. Muy valorable conocimiento en Power Apps y PowerBI.
Deseables conocimientos en SAP.
Valorable conocimientos previos de Industria Farmacéutica o afines.
Idiomas: Inglés Fluido hablado y escrito (B2).


Eli Lilly and Company, Lilly USA, LLC and our wholly owned subsidiaries (collectively “Lilly”) are committed to help individuals with disabilities to participate in the workforce and ensure equal opportunity to compete for jobs. If you require an accommodation to submit a resume for positions at Lilly, please email Lilly Human Resources ( Lilly_Recruiting_Compliance@lists.lilly.com ) for further assistance. Please note This email address is intended for use only to request an accommodation as part of the application process. Any other correspondence will not receive a response.

Lilly does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

#WeAreLilly

Title: Data Analyst, GeoAnalytics - BCG X
Description:
Data Analyst, GeoAnalytics

15463BR




BCG X

BCG X is the tech build & design unit of BCG. Turbocharging BCG’s deep industry and functional expertise, BCG X brings together advanced tech knowledge and ambitious entrepreneurship to help organizations enable innovation at scale. With nearly 3,000 technologists, scientists, programmers, engineers, and human-centered designers located across 80+ cities, BCG X builds and designs platforms and software to address the world’s most important challenges and opportunities. Teaming across our practices, and in close collaboration with our clients, our end-to-end global team unlocks new possibilities. Together we’re creating the bold and disruptive products, services, and businesses of tomorrow.

BCG GAMMA as part of BCG X is dedicated to building cutting-edge AI and digital systems that go beyond prototypes to transform our clients’ core businesses. Powered by proprietary data assets, our custom products integrate into clients’ unique tech stacks to enable better, faster decision making.




WHAT YOU'LL DO :

GAMMA - part of BCG X is BCG’s premier data science and advanced analytics capability with 1000+ data scientists, engineers, and analysts globally. Within GAMMA, the Specialty team (GAMMA S) is a hybrid client-facing/consulting-support that leverages available tools and code bases to deliver powerful and specialized insights that help our clients tackle their most pressing business problems. We partner with BCG case teams and practices across the full analytics value chain: framing new business challenges and problems, designing and executing innovative analytical solutions, and interpreting findings for our clients. GeoAnalytics is a sub-team in GAMMA S with expertise in geospatial analytics and tools. Our 30+ member team is a global resource, working with clients in every BCG region and in every industry area. It is a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge technologies.




YOU'RE GOOD AT :

As an Analyst in GeoAnalytics, you will be solving a variety of location-based analytical problems for our clients. You will utilize your knowledge of geospatial data and analytics while using a variety of tools such as Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Python, and visualization/analytical platforms (ex. Tableau, Alteryx). You will leverage a range of techniques such as geospatial clustering, network analysis, location-based optimization and predictive analytics/modeling.




YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS) :

Education & Experience:

1-3 years of relevant work experience in GeoAnalytics with advanced degree preferred
Relevant degree in geospatial related field such as: Geography, Remote Sensing, Urban Planning, Statistics/GeoStatistics, Applied Mathematics, or Computer Science
Previous experience working in a global organization or professional services firm is preferred
Data management skills (e.g. data modeling, data integrity QA/QC, database administration)
GIS software such as ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS, CARTO
Data science programming/coding in Python and/or R
Descriptive statistics and statistical methods (e.g. correlation, regression, clustering, etc.) with applications in machine learning
Exposure to BI/Data visualization platforms such as Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Handling, processing, and deriving insights from remotely sensed data preferred




EQUAL OPPORTUNITY

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

Education & Experience:

  • 1-3 years of relevant work experience in GeoAnalytics with advanced degree preferred
  • Relevant degree in geospatial related field such as: Geography, Remote Sensing, Urban Planning, Statistics/GeoStatistics, Applied Mathematics, or Computer Science
  • Previous experience working in a global organization or professional services firm is preferred
  • Data management skills (e.g. data modeling, data integrity QA/QC, database administration)
  • GIS software such as ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS, CARTO
  • Data science programming/coding in Python and/or R
  • Descriptive statistics and statistical methods (e.g. correlation, regression, clustering, etc.) with applications in machine learning
  • Exposure to BI/Data visualization platforms such as Tableau, Power BI, etc.
  • Handling, processing, and deriving insights from remotely sensed data preferred


EQUAL OPPORTUNITY

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

Insights you can act on




While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.




When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees “members” because they are CGI shareholders and owners, and, as owners, we enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today—one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.




At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where everyone belongs, and we collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal opportunity employer, we empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.




Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI—where your ideas and actions make a difference.

Title: Data Analyst con Power BI
Description:
Buscamos para trabajar a través nuestra como Data Analyst, principalemnte con la herramienta Power BI.

Buscamos a alguien con experiencia en Business Intelligence en Reporting y Modelado de datos con ganas de trabajar en nuestros equipos multidisciplinares.

Funciones

Diseñarás y construirás modelos analíticos de datos Diseñarás cuadros de mando, informes y realizarás reporting avanzado Trabajarás en entornos analíticos de grandes entidades, manejando un alto volumen de datos.

Requisitos

Experiencia con diseño y construcción de modelos analíticos.

Diseño de cuadros de mando, informes y reporting avanzado.

Alto nivel Power BI.

Valorable: conocimientos Azure y Snowflake.

Condiciones Laborales

Lugar de Trabajo: España.

Tipo de Contrato: A Término Indefinido.

Salario: A convenir de acuerdo a la experiencia

Title: Data Analyst Sector Energético (Madrid/Barcelona) (8001)
Description:
El negocio de Comercialización desafía el reto del crecimiento; despuntando en competitividad, reinventando la relación con el cliente, acelerando la digitalización y la generación distribuida para impulsar la energía renovable.




Necesitamos personas de acción, con ganas de aprender, sin miedo y con entusiasmo para evolucionar mirando al futuro.

¡Queremos ser los mejores en lo que hacemos! Trabajando en equipo, haciendo más con menos y desarrollando a cada persona, para crecer juntos tanto en el ámbito comercial como en el de otros negocios, gracias a las oportunidades de movilidad interna del grupo Naturgy.




¿Te apuntas al desafío?




En este contexto buscamos talento para la posición de Data Analyst Sector Energético




Como Data Analyst Sector Energético serás parte de este reto ilusionante donde los datos están en la base de las decisiones de negocio orientadas a la consecución de los objetivos estratégicos de la compañía, en diversos ámbitos de la comercialización de energía y servicios energéticos.




Los retos de tu día a día estarán orientados a:

Desarrollo y generación de procesos ETL para la carga y transformación de la información origen, permitiendo la creación de informes.
Realización de análisis avanzados que faciliten la toma de decisiones, desde la propuesta de requerimientos hasta la presentación de resultados.
Identificación y generación de variables sintéticas asegurando la coherencia en las extracciones entre las diferentes fuentes de información de la compañía.
Automatización de procesos con herramientas de perfil DevOps (AWS Lambdas, Azure Functions ,Git, Athena, …).
Utilización de herramientas de query/reporting, creación de informes y consultas a bases de datos con SAS, SQL, Power BI, QuickSight.
Desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos predictivos y su explotación en entornos cloud para su consumo (Sagemaker AWS, Glue Jobs,..).




Lo que necesitas:

Titulación: Grado superior en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática, Ingeniería, Física o Física Aplicada.
Conocimiento de manejo de BBDD (SQL, PL-SQL, SAS) y lenguajes de programación orientados a generar análisis estadísticos (Python, SAS, R).
Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, QuickSight).
Experiencia mínima de dos años en funciones de Data Analytics.
Idiomas: Inglés (mínimo C1).

Valorable

Conocimiento del sector energético
Experiencia en proyectos con tecnología Cloud (Azure, AWS).
Valorable un segundo idioma.




Lo que ofrecemos

Trabajar en un equipo colaborativo y multidisciplinar.
Ambiente que promueve la diversidad e igualdad.
Programa formativo y de desarrollo.
Compromiso con la conciliación y la flexibilidad, con formato de trabajo híbrido.
Espíritu innovador en un entorno retador y motivador.
Networking y trabajo en equipo con ubicación en Madrid.




¿Te apuntas al desafío?

1) Rellena el formulario con tus datos. Para completar el perfil, te recomendamos adjuntar tu CV actualizado y certificado de inglés.

2) Si cumples el perfil contactaremos contigo para participar en las diferentes pruebas y entrevistas.

3) Si avanzas con éxito en el proceso ¡te damos la bienvenida al equipo Naturgy!

Title: Beca Talentum - Data Analysis
Description:
Te estamos buscando! Nuestra apuesta es por el Talento Joven y por eso queremos que formes parte de Talentum. Un programa de impulso al Talento Joven de Telefónica, que ofrece oportunidades a través de su extensa oferta de becas, formación y retos en equipo.

¿Qué hacemos en el equipo?

En el equipo de Business Analytics facilitamos la toma de decisiones basadas en datos. Entre las distintas tareas que realizamos en el equipo destacan asegurar la calidad de los datos que recibimos, analizarlos para extraer insights e información de negocio y generar cuadros de mando basados en esos datos.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?

El candidato participará en la definición y construcción de plataformas analíticas para apoyar la toma de decisiones basada en datos. Para ello realizará tareas como:

Asegurar la calidad del dato
Generación de KPIs mediante consultas en Base de Datos
Construcción de cuadros de mando con herramientas comerciales
Análisis avanzados


Una vez finalizado el período formativo se espera que el estudiante tenga un nivel avanzado en aspectos técnicos como SQL o visualización de datos junto con una visión global de la explotación de los datos en un operador de telecomunicaciones.

¿Qué buscamos en las personas del equipo?

Titulación: Grado en Ingeniería, Informática, Matemáticas o Estadística.

El candidato ideal será una persona con mente analítica y pensamiento lógico que cuide la calidad y los detalles en los trabajos propuestos abordándolos de una forma ordenada y estructurada. Además se espera que sea un apasionado del mundo del dato y que proponga nuevas ideas y soluciones en las tareas que se le propongan.

Se valorarán conocimientos de:

Manejo de Bases de Datos (SQL)
Herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, Looker)
Si te unes a nosotros te ofrecemos:

Jornada de 35 horas con una ayuda al estudio de 1.100 € mensuales.
Beca con duración minima de 6 meses y máximo 12 meses.
Trabajar en un equipo dinámico con proyectos retadores.
Te ofrecemos realizar parte de la práctica en remoto (modelo híbrido)
Ubicación de la beca: Madrid
… ¡Y plan formativo durante la beca!


¡Te esperamos!

Cuando te unes a Telefónica.

Te unes a casi 100 años de historia, un equipo de 106 nacionalidades presentes en más de 35 países. Te unes a un equipo que trabaja por conectar a las personas allá donde estén, sin fronteras. Un equipo que está liderando la revolución digital con la ilusión del primer día en todos nuestros negocios, creando el mejor ecosistema digital para nuestros clientes. En Telefónica tienes todo lo que necesitas para crear la mejor versión de ti mismo. Necesitamos gente como tú que se sume a este gran reto, que quiera crear la Telefónica del mañana.

En Telefónica apostamos por las nuevas formas de trabajo y somos líderes en la implementación de la Desconexión Digital bajo el principio “Desconecta para Reconectar”.

#SomosDiversos

Estamos convencidos de que los equipos diversos e inclusivos son más innovadores, transformadores y consiguen mejores resultados. Por ello promovemos y garantizamos la inclusión de todas las personas sin importar género, edad, orientación e identidad sexual, cultura, discapacidad o cualquier otra condición personal.

#TalentoJoven #JóvenesEnTelefónica #TalentoDiverso #TalentumUnidadesGlobales #Talentum

Title: ANALISTA DE DATOS / CIENTÍFICO DE DATOS (PYTHON)
Description:
¡En Kimia seguimos creciendo!




Las empresas de Kimia Group somos líderes en nuestro sector, donde la ciencia y tecnología son las herramientas clave para mejorar nuestros resultados y los de nuestros clientes.




Actualmente nos encontramos buscando un Analista de Datos / Científico de Datos (Python) para nuestra empresa Erso Labs en su departamento de IT, equipo esencial para el crecimiento de las empresas del grupo. Serás el Analista de Datos / Científico de Datos de nuestro proyecto "Score".




Score es una tecnología que predice y recomienda qué componentes visuales tienen que tener imágenes, videos y textos en posts en redes sociales para tener más éxito (likes, visualizaciones, comentarios).




También detecta y recomienda qué elementos aseguran el éxito (ventas, impacto) en los assets de los anuncios online que aparecen en plataformas como Google, Facebook, Bing, etc.




Principales responsabilidades:




Análisis de datos en las plataformas de distintas redes: Google Ads, Business Manager de Facebook, TikTok Ads Manager, Twitter Ads Manager, Amazon Business, Bing, etc.
Creación y mantenimiento de pipelines de entrenamiento de modelos de machine learning de computer vision y de NLP.
Creación y mantenimiento de pipelines de entranamiento de modelos de machine learning de datos tabulares (estadísiticas) para series temporales, recomendaciones, clasificaciones y predicciones.
Creación y mantenimiento del sistema de inferencia de modelos de machine learning en los datos no estructurados (imágenes, videos y textos) extraidos de las redes sociales y de las plataformas para anunciantes más importantes.
Comunicación continua con el equipo de marketing, comprensión de los problemas de negocio y propuesta de soluciones creativas para los mismos.




REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:




Grado o Máster en una carrera de ciencias cómo matemáticas, física, ingeniería informática.
Experiencia como analista de datos / científico de datos de 3 años.
Experiencia programando con python de 3 años creando ETLs, creando informes y solucionando problemas matemáticos.
Experiencia de 2 años creando pipelines de entrenamiento, modelos de machine learning de computer vision, NLP y datos tabulares (predicción, clasificación y series temporales de datos estadísticos).
Nivel de inglés: mínimo B2.

Requerimientos Deseables:




Experiencia previa en proyectos de marketing digital en plataformas como:




Google Ads
Business Manager de Facebook
TikTok Ads Manager
Twitter Ads Manager
Amazon Business
Bing

Qué ofrecemos:




Incorporarte en una empresa referente en el mercado donde podrás seguir desarrollandote profesionalmente junto a un equipo de primer nivel.
Trabajar en una empresa joven y dinámica en la que te sentirás uno/a mas desde el primer día.
Fantástico ambiente de trabajo en el que la diversidad e inclusión es uno de nuestros pilares estratégicos.
Remuneración competitiva con posibilidad interesante de paquete de retribución flexible.
Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del año y los meses de verano.
El día de tu cumpleaños te lo damos de vacaciones.
Nuestra cultura basada en la excelencia, el aprendizaje y la responsabilidad, donde cada empleado es protagonista de su propio desarrollo.

Title: Junior Digital and Social Insights Analyst, Spain
Description:
We are looking for an energetic and motivated Junior Digital and Social Insights Analyst in Madrid. We are looking for a native-level Spanish speaker with excellent knowledge of Spanish culture and language references. You must also be completely fluent in written and spoken English.

Ideally, you’re an entrepreneurial self-starter, who has a passion for identifying and delivering insights that drive business decisions. We are looking for you if you normally ask yourself “so what?” to everything. Experience in social media analysis and a basic knowledge of social media query development would be a plus, but not mandatory as we will provide ongoing training on new social media platforms, channels and social analytics techniques.

Beyond social media analysis, experience in other digital research methodologies is also a plus (i.e. online focus groups, online surveys, digital analytics, and content analysis).

Have you worked in an agency? That would also be another great point in your favour, although not mandatory.

You will work translating business questions into digital and social media solutions, developing methodologies that utilise the range of analytical techniques available across the market. Understanding client needs and finding solutions will be key to your work and you will love going deep to surface compelling qualitative and quantitative insights.

You will be part of a global team.

This role is based in Spain and you will be working mostly from home. However, we ask that you meet with your line manager (also based in Madrid) at least once a week in a co-working space to work together. For the first few weeks, so as to be fully embedded in the company and clients, we might ask you to meet with your line manager more regularly (2-3 times a week).

Requirements

You must speak and write both English and Spanish fluently. You should understand both the language and context of Spain with ease.

You must have a BA/BS or equivalent undergraduate degree or equivalent practical experience.

You will be required to be:

Digitally savvy - able to understand and engage on Digital and Social Media platforms and understand how communication varies by platform (Twitter vs Facebook etc.). You should be conversant with abbreviations, platform-specific words and acronyms, and local variations specific to your country or language.
Show analytical capabilities. Additional previous experience as a Social Media Analyst or Digital Analyst would be a plus.
Possess excellent written communication skills, both in Spanish and English.
Able to work well independently and as part of a team.
Show excellent attention to detail.


Experience: recent graduates, 1-2 years of experience.

Benefits

Convosphere is a social-first insights agency, we recognise that the value of global social listening lies in the impact data-driven decisions can make – and the cultural relevance required to make them actionable. Through hands-on human-led social data analysis across 100+ languages, and with offices around the world we have unprecedented data access into hard-to-reach markets where we can deliver deep consumer insights that bring our global clients closer to local audiences.

Based in-market, our skilled team of analysts are native speakers of over 100 languages, with a deep understanding of both the cultural and sector-specific context of the language. We have a range of clients, from agencies to direct enterprises, across diverse sectors, such as pharmaceuticals, consumer electronics, fashion and beauty as well as entertainment. These clients are looking to us to share deep cultural insights to answer their business questions, for example: "What do people think of our products or services or those of our competitors? Who are our customers and what does their buying journey look like? How can we find influencers to help market our products?"

Convosphere is an independent, growing business. Founded in 2014 and headquartered in Hammersmith London, we are a varied and fun bunch, all passionate about showcasing the insights that social media has to offer. This is a great opportunity to work in an interesting and varied role for our growing, global business - as our business grows so will your role enabling you to progress your career swiftly.

Remuneration includes a competitive salary (dependent on experience) as well as share options and performance-related bonus.
We are open to the discussion of flexible or agile working arrangements including remote working and reduced or compressed hours.


You can find out more about us and what we do at https://convosphere.com/.

You can find details of our privacy policy for candidates at https://convosphere.com/careers/privacy-policy-for-candidates/.

Title: Junior Data Analyst | Full-time (Remote)
Description:
The Data Analyst is part of the Clinical Operations Group (COG) Data & Analytics organization of our company. This team, both technically-focused and hospital-facing, is responsible for our enterprise clinical reporting. With a goal of reducing avoidable variation in clinical practice, it has proven successful through targeted programs that leverage actionable and transparent analytics to drive positive change.

General Responsibilities

Independently builds actionable data visualizations that identify areas of opportunity and help drive Care Excellence at scale. Primary BI platform is Microsoft PowerBI.
Develops custom metrics and reports to support the Clinical Operations Group analytics framework and meet facility and division reporting needs
Writes advanced SQL to extract and model data from multiple databases (Teradata, GCP, SQL, etc.)
Provide Tier 4 level support for enterprise BI products
Leads mid-scale projects independently with oversight by Manager as needed; spans collaboration with clinical stakeholders to the full product development cycle (data capture to BI integration)
Informs development of data models in the EDW based on data visualization requirements
Facilitates effective and respectful communication among all team members and leadership to ensure comprehensive understanding of needs, expectations and requirements
Serves as a mentor to team members with less experience
Maximizes productivity and accountability through effective time management, coordination, and communication
Performs other related duties as assigned to support the COG Analytics Team


Benefits

We offers a total rewards package that supports the health, life, career and retirement of our colleagues. The available plans and programs include:

Comprehensive medical coverage that covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation.
Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more.
Fertility and family building benefits through Progyny
Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing
Family support, including adoption assistance, child and elder care resources and consumer discounts
401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service)
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Retirement readiness and rollover services and preferred banking partnerships
Education assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships)
Colleague recognition program
Time Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long- and short-term disability coverage and leaves of absence)
Show more Show less

Title: Jr Data Analyst - Remote | WFH
Description:
Get It Recruit - Information Technology helps job seekers connect with employers and opportunities that match their qualifications. Once connected job seekers can complete the full application process directly on the employer's website.

We are seeking passionate and detail-oriented individuals to join our team in revolutionizing patient care. As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in improving the quality of clinical data by meticulously reviewing and annotating it. You will work alongside a talented and diverse team of clinical researchers, data scientists, engineers, and statisticians who are committed to the intersection of clinical knowledge and advanced data science.

The ideal candidate for this position is a visual learner with exceptional attention to detail. You should feel comfortable working with medical data and be motivated to contribute to our mission of enhancing patient care.

Requirements

Bachelor's or Master's degree in health informatics, nursing, biology or related field

At least 1 year of clinical experience as a Medical Scribe, Medical Assistant, Nurse Practitioner, or Clinical Research Associate

Experience handling protected health information

Proficiency in clinical parameters, medical terminology, and ontologies such as ICD-10-CM, SNOMED-CT, CPT, RxNorm and LOINC

Basic knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including common functions across worksheets and workbooks

Preferred Qualifications

Strong clinical background with exceptional attention to detail

Familiarity with formatted clinical notes

Knowledge of oncological diagnoses and treatments

Exceptional Execution Skills, Organizational And Coordination Experience

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Strong interest in healthcare and an eagerness to learn

As a key member of our multi-disciplinary team, you will:

Utilize your clinical experience to annotate and quality-assure existing labels of medical data using our editing interface and pre-defined tags that you will learn during the onboarding process.

Annotate clinical data from different databases based on linguistic role, clinical classification, structure role in medical note, and/or extraction of clinical attributes with normalization.

Be responsible for data de-duplication (matching and merging data) and data cleansing (matching, linking, updating records).

Utilize multiple sources of data, including tools to analyze and resolve problems.

Approach work requirements in a methodical and conscientious manner.

Prioritize tasks and follow them through to completion in a timely manner, with minimal supervision.

This is a contract position located in Redmond, Washington, with a competitive hourly rate ranging from $23 to $33, depending on experience. Work hours are from 8am to 5pm.

At our company, we are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please let us know.

Join us in our mission to improve patient care by applying today!

Please note that Get It Recruit - Information Technology is sharing this job opening on behalf of the employer. Any questions related to the job description or application process should be directed to the employer. To learn more about the position and begin the application process, please use our 'apply' button.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in improving the quality of clinical data by meticulously reviewing and annotating it. You will work alongside a talented and diverse team of clinical researchers, data scientists, engineers, and statisticians who are committed to the intersection of clinical knowledge and advanced data science.

The ideal candidate for this position is a visual learner with exceptional attention to detail. You should feel comfortable working with medical data and be motivated to contribute to our mission of enhancing patient care.

Requirements

Bachelor's or Master's degree in health informatics, nursing, biology or related field

At least 1 year of clinical experience as a Medical Scribe, Medical Assistant, Nurse Practitioner, or Clinical Research Associate

Experience handling protected health information

Proficiency in clinical parameters, medical terminology, and ontologies such as ICD-10-CM, SNOMED-CT, CPT, RxNorm and LOINC

Basic knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including common functions across worksheets and workbooks

Preferred Qualifications

Strong clinical background with exceptional attention to detail

Familiarity with formatted clinical notes

Knowledge of oncological diagnoses and treatments

Exceptional Execution Skills, Organizational And Coordination Experience

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Strong interest in healthcare and an eagerness to learn

As a key member of our multi-disciplinary team, you will:

Utilize your clinical experience to annotate and quality-assure existing labels of medical data using our editing interface and pre-defined tags that you will learn during the onboarding process.

Annotate clinical data from different databases based on linguistic role, clinical classification, structure role in medical note, and/or extraction of clinical attributes with normalization.

Be responsible for data de-duplication (matching and merging data) and data cleansing (matching, linking, updating records).

Utilize multiple sources of data, including tools to analyze and resolve problems.

Approach work requirements in a methodical and conscientious manner.

Prioritize tasks and follow them through to completion in a timely manner, with minimal supervision.

This is a contract position located in Redmond, Washington, with a competitive hourly rate ranging from $23 to $33, depending on experience. Work hours are from 8am to 5pm.

At our company, we are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please let us know.

Join us in our mission to improve patient care by applying today!
  • Please note that Get It Recruit - Information Technology is sharing this job opening on behalf of the employer. Any questions related to the job description or application process should be directed to the employer. To learn more about the position and begin the application process, please use our 'apply' button.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Seattle, WA 98101

Duration: 12 + months contract

Pay rate: $35 – $40/Hr on W2

Summary:

In this role, you will be expected to support the team in creating metrics dashboards, producing operational KPIs, and partnering with stakeholders on the People team to support Pinterest leaders, managers, and employees.


What you’ll do:

Develop reporting solutions and dashboards to show current state and progress on People team KPIs
Analyze trends and provide value-added insights through the use of statistical analysis
Support development of data analytic products with self-service capabilities for stakeholders
Support automation and preparation of regular reports on the People team’s KPIs.
Advocate for continuous improvement by identifying clear measures of success and influencing process design to enable more effective data products
Define business needs through discovery sessions with key stakeholder


What we’re looking for:

3+ years’ experience in similar type of work preferred
Ability to build small to midsize business intelligence (BI) solutions – data sets, queries, reports, dashboards, analyses – or components of larger solutions to answer business questions with data
Use one or more industry analytics visualization tools (in particular Tableau)
Ability to manipulate large data sets with high dimensionality and complexity
Experience with SQL and Python
Prior experience in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in Human Resources
Basic understanding of statistical methods (descriptive and inferential) is a plus as you will be partnering with People Analytics team members
Experience in data storytelling and use of data visualizations to bring important takeaways to life
Ability to create narratives and support business partners to engage in data-driven decision making
Experience in Snowflake and Human Resources technology and tools, including experience with Workday, Greenhouse, or other ATS is a plus


Rate/Salary: $35.00/Hr. to $40.00/Hr.

Title: Business/ Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Job Requirements And Preferences

We are looking for a Business/ Data Analyst who knows HR processes and procedure (any country) to support an HR transformation programme eg:

Transform and enable better decision-making through the usage of advanced analytics
Partner business teams to understand the business area, work with the team to evolve and define the business problems, translate the same into an analytical problem, design solution approach to solve the same and help execute to deliver relevant insights that lead to actions.
Connect and explore large data-sets (both internal and external), help gather, analyse, and model data to solve complex business problems. Guide data science team on Diagnostic and Predictive Models to solve the business problem applying a range of techniques across classical statistics, Machine Learning (e.g. regression, clustering, variance analysis and basic exploratory univariate and bi-variate data analyses)
Be creative and a committed problem-solver using Data and Advanced analytics skill alongside leadership and direct engagement of business leaders
Have proven understanding of business strategies, goals and processes, and how Business Analytics can positively impact them


As a VR Business/ Data Analyst, you will have the flexibility to manage your own day, as long as you meet your set objectives and client demands. Often your team will be a mix of on-site and remote based members who will connect using IM, video calls and an online ticketing system. Good communication skills and time management is essential for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Role Data Analyst
Locations Seattle, WA (remote for now, relocation post Covid )
Start date ASAP
Duration 10 Months




JD




Key Qualities




A team player and adaptable to changing environment
Strong communication and presentation skills, leadership skills, ability to drive the stakeholders to determine the Requirements.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to present information in differing degrees of detail and form depending on the audience
Excellent organizational skills, time management skills, sharp analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to multi-task and perform in a fast paced environment with tight deadlines and demanding environment
Ability to liaison between lines of business and the development team, while working with a wide range of stakeholders and collaborating with your team.
Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
Experience working both independently and in a virtual, collaborative environment is essential. Comfortable working in a matrix management model with stakeholders and virtual teams across global locations
Ability to navigate and understand technical documentation and/or system documentation
Strong knowledge of back-end and front-end application components




Required Skills And Qualifications




3 to 5 years of experience with in a financial services organization, exposure to any Regulatory or compliance product is a Plus.
10+ years of industry experience, including deep technical experience with big data platforms and data management organizations doing hands-on Data Engineering or data-related Software Engineering.
Strong design, coding, debugging and analytical skills, especially across the big data ecosystem (e.g. Cloudera Hadoop)
Excellent command of the SQL language
Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and big data tools (Spark, Hive, HDFS, etc.). Experience in architecture, data management, application ownership, AWS, Qlik Sense and other IT role experience a plus
Plug-and-Play Area Product Owner who can create JIRAs, groom them with tech partners and supervise testing.
Prior Project Managements and test management experience would be helpful.
Must have ability to deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines and be comfortable manipulating and summarizing large quantities of data

All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans and implementing technology to help transform organizations.



Working as a consultant you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP and built on tangible accomplishments.



As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, there are a few things you should know:



We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them.
We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth-minded.
We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.

If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more.



THE RGP CONSULTING EXPERIENCE



RGP has a unique consulting model that provides opportunities for consultants to work in different ways. Most consultants work in a model where they have the flexibility and autonomy to choose projects aligning to their experience, skills and desired lifestyle. Other opportunities exist in team-based, strategy and solutions work. In all models, you will feel the full support of RGP to assist you in your work and guide you on your chosen path.



PURPOSE OF THE ROLE



As a Data Analyst, you will assist business leaders in making improved business decisions through the analysis of large data sets, creation of comprehensive reports and informed recommendations.



ATTRIBUTES OF CONSULTANTS WITH RGP



Respect for people and opinions and confidently offer your point-of-view with clients and among colleagues
A drive for proactively cultivating relationships with clients and colleagues
Optimism when faced with challenges and complex situations, coupled with the drive to solve client issues
Dedication to continuous improvement and development of your skillset and talents
A strong personal identification with RGP’s values – loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability and talent

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE



Analyze, manipulate, profile and extracts large data sets
Assist with documenting requirements
Build, review and modify data reports
Transfer knowledge to client team members to enable them to be self-sufficient in building and maintaining reports to address future needs

DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS



Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, MIS or other related business discipline required
5 to 10 years of data analysis experience
Strong understanding of financial statements and the interrelationship of the income statement, balance sheet and statement of cash flows, including account reconciliation and financial analysis skills
Excellent interpersonal communication skills
Capable of working independently; a self-starter
Experience with SAP or Oracle software required, including the ability to access reports and data as needed
Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills required, including strong data retrieval and downloading abilities, and proficiency with macros, PowerBI, PowerPivot, etc.
Technical capability in one or more of the following: SQL, Tableau, QlikView, Cognos, ERWin, etc. strongly preferred

BENEFITS



Pay Range: $55-70/hr
Compensation is commensurate with employee qualifications, experience, and other factors including geographic location, market and operational factors.
Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life insurance, Disability insurance, 401(k) savings plan, Employee Stock Purchase plan, Professional development program, Paid Time Off, Paid Sick Time (in geographies where legally required)

Equal Opportunity Employer



RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or veteran status, and encourage all applicants to apply.

Title: Data Engineer/ Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Role Data Engineer/ Data Analyst




Experience 8 - 12 Yrs




Location Seattle Remote until end of COVID




Job Description




CRE Business Data Architecture team is responsible for driving critical cross-functional projects in support of designing, building, and implementing customer-centric data assets for use by the CRE stakeholders across the firm. The candidate must exhibit a thorough understanding of data structures, data manipulation, metadata, data security, and data quality management. In addition, the candidate should have a good understanding of CB businesses, functions, systems, data environments, and processes that are necessary for the production and utilization of modeling data.




We are searching for a Data engineer who is very enthusiastic about data and building high-quality data solutions as part of our team committed to continuous learning and building a diverse & inclusive environment. The candidate must have the ability to collaborate with stakeholders and partners inside and outside of the department to understand their needs and design and develop robust data solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations. The ideal candidate will possess JPM institutional data and system knowledge, technical skills, an understanding of data science, and a commitment to producing high quality results.




Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.

Description:
Description:

Job Summary:

Lay the groundwork for a dynamic future with an industry leader. At Kaiser Permanente, you'll forge lasting relationships with colleagues across the organization while enjoying the opportunity to grow your experience and hone your expertise on assignments that have real impact. Our interns have worked on everything from analyzing financial software and developing new marketing strategies, to designing mobile apps and helping clinicians improve care delivery. We want you to get the most out of your time here and will give you projects that challenge you to think freely, question thoroughly, and explore deeply.

Internship Location:

This role is scheduled to be 100% remote. While remote, finalists MUST reside in a one of the following states to be eligible for employment with Kaiser Permanente: CA, CO, DC, GA, HI, MD, NY, OR, VA, or WA.

Department Description:

This team conducts data engineering by developing data warehouses in support of KP's markets.

Intern Projects:

The intern will be a part of one of our scrum teams and will help with engineering tasks and data content tasks.

SQL
Data analysis

Contributing to a designated project or initiative to meet a KP business objective.

N/A

Title: Data Engineer/Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Role Data Engineer/ Data Analyst




Location Seattle Remote until end of COVID




Job Description




CRE Business Data Architecture team is responsible for driving critical cross-functional projects in support of designing, building, and implementing customer-centric data assets for use by the CRE stakeholders across the firm. The candidate must exhibit a thorough understanding of data structures, data manipulation, metadata, data security, and data quality management. In addition, the candidate should have a good understanding of CB businesses, functions, systems, data environments, and processes that are necessary for the production and utilization of modeling data.




We are searching for a Data engineer who is very enthusiastic about data and building high-quality data solutions as part of our team committed to continuous learning and building a diverse & inclusive environment. The candidate must have the ability to collaborate with stakeholders and partners inside and outside of the department to understand their needs and design and develop robust data solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations. The ideal candidate will possess JPM institutional data and system knowledge, technical skills, an understanding of data science, and a commitment to producing high quality results.




Key Qualities




A team player and adaptable to changing environment
Strong communication and presentation skills, leadership skills, ability to drive the stakeholders to determine the Requirements.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to present information in differing degrees of detail and form depending on the audience
Excellent organizational skills, time management skills, sharp analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to multi-task and perform in a fast paced environment with tight deadlines and demanding environment
Ability to liaison between lines of business and the development team, while working with a wide range of stakeholders and collaborating with your team.
Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
Experience working both independently and in a virtual, collaborative environment is essential. Comfortable working in a matrix management model with stakeholders and virtual teams across global locations
Ability to navigate and understand technical documentation and/or system documentation
Strong knowledge of back-end and front-end application components




Required Skills And Qualifications




3 to 5 years of experience with in a financial services organization, exposure to any Regulatory or compliance product is a Plus.
3 to 5 years of experience in gathering business requirements, understanding and articulating them in forums where need be, interaction with Stakeholders and Business owners is a must have
5+ years experience working in AWS
10+ years of industry experience, including deep technical experience with big data platforms and data management organizations doing hands-on Data Engineering or data-related Software Engineering.
Strong design, coding, debugging and analytical skills, especially across the big data ecosystem (e.g. Cloudera Hadoop)
Excellent command of the SQL language
Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and big data tools (Spark, Hive, HDFS, etc.). Experience in architecture, data management, application ownership, AWS, Qlik Sense and other IT role experience a plus
Plug-and-Play Area Product Owner who can create JIRAs, groom them with tech partners and supervise testing.
Prior Project Managements and test management experience would be helpful.
Must have ability to deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines and be comfortable manipulating and summarizing large quantities of data




Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.

Title: Data Analyst/Report Developer
Description:
Point B Direct, a subsidiary of Point B, Inc., focuses on matching candidates with the right role and the right culture. Our value-fit approach will allow you to feel confident and successful while building your skill set for the next project and reaching your goals. Point B Direct work is project-based, contract roles. You will work directly with our customers and become an extension of their team – delivering value with each project you touch.




Opportunity




Point B Direct is working with a Seattle-based client looking to hire a contract Data Analyst/Report Developer. This role is a hybrid work schedule with the client requiring several days onsite in Seattle per week. Resource must be based out of Seattle.




Job Summary




10 years proven technical experience analyzing and designing data infrastructure and system requirements to extract and organize data for authorized user access. Proven work experience as a Data Architect, Data Scientist, Data Migration specialist, or similar role. Duties include identifying client’s internal and external data sources, collaborating with various BUs to determine their data storage and organizational needs and using the information to create a One Source of Truth (EDW) and maintain data infrastructure for end users and managers.




Duties And Responsibilities




Hands-on experience leading architectural discussions and design exercises to build and automate large scale migration of data




Architect, design and oversee the development of the database mapping and migration processes




Optimize new and current database systems




Ensures data integrity and security




Plan and design the processes for data migration to ensure data integrity and completeness, quality, and preserve security




In-depth understanding of database migration principles




Experience with migration of mission critical databases across multiple database platforms




Knowledge of data mining and segmentation techniques




Expertise in Java, Javascript, Node.js, Python or Ruby is preferred




Familiarity with data visualization and BI tools and methodologies, e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, Quicksight




Compensation Model




Hourly non-exempt




Qualifications/Competencies




Must hold a Bachelor’s Degree (BA/BS) in computer science, information systems, Mathematics, MIS or related field.




Must have experience working with Scrum and Agile Development methodologies.




Must have strong Oral and Written Communication skills




Must have structured design, development, and implementation of new computing architectures




Must be able to operate independently while establishing strong working relationships with other teams and team members




Must have strong organizational and prioritization skills




Must demonstrate critical attention to detail and deadlines




Must be able to adapt to change in direction and priorities in a project and deadline-oriented environment




Work Environment And Physical Requirements




Ability to travel to client site (if applicable)




Ability to work from home




Ability to work non-standard work hours as necessary




Ability to remain in a stationary position for more than 50% of the day




Ability to operate a laptop and other office productivity equipment




Disclaimer




This job description is not meant to cover or include all the tasks, duties or responsibilities the employee is required to perform. Job duties and responsibilities may change at any time or without notice.




Are you intrigued to learn more?




When you apply for this role, your information will be personally reviewed by our talent acquisition team (not by a robot).




We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability.




Learn more about contract projects with Point B Direct.

Title: Data Analytics
Description:
Job Description




Role: Data Analytics




Location: Seattle, WA




Role Summary




The Senior data Analytics is responsible for analytics strategy, data science, and business intelligence reporting, provide all aspects of business intelligence, advanced analytic modelling, and analysis to business stakeholders in order to drive performance, growth, and profitability.




Responsibilities




Proven knowledge working with relational databases including design, structure, and database management functions.
Demonstrated experience working with large, complex data sets and disparate data sources across various platforms.
Advanced SQL skills
Demonstrated experience working with NoSQL data sources.
Proven proficiency in visualization techniques, dashboard design, decision support tools, and automation, with experience using data visualization
Proven proficiency in programming languages
Excellent communication skills, including experience presenting to executive level leadership and communicating complex ideas in an understandable manner to management
Experience with version control software and tools (Git, GitHub, Azure DevOps)
Experience in developing KPIs / management system dashboards and reporting
Experience with Azure or other cloud providers
Proficiency using Databricks for data engineering, modeling, and deployment
Experience with distributed computing platforms (Hadoop, Apache Spark, Pig, Hive, etc.)
Experience with statistics/machine learning packages such as Spark MLlib, Python (scikit-learn, pandas, numpy, scipy, Matplotlib), Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch etc
(SQL Server, PostGres, Oracle)
Experience in ETL / ELT processes (specifically through linked servers / Open Query)
Experience creating dashboards / stories in Tableau
Experience with process design and Agile practices




Preferred




Experience with operations research techniques (Monte Carlo, Markov Chain, queuing theory, etc.)
